How much does a police officer make? According to the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics, the 632,000 police and law enforcement officers employed in the United States earn an annual mean police officer salary of $57,770, which is equivalent to an average hourly wage of $27.78. Police officers employed for the federal government make considerably less than average at $52,620 each year, but those that work for the state government make $62,810. The top-paying states are New Jersey and California, where police officers earn $84,930 and $84,320 respectively.
